article: 4 Ways to Find Your Lost iPhone When It’s Offline or Dead

steps.title: Ask a friend to help you find your phone using Find My.
steps.subtitle: While your friends can’t help you directly using the Find My app, there is a feature that will help you connect to your iCloud account through the app on a friend’s phone. This is a great option in a pinch if you don’t have access to a computer or another device connected to your Apple ID. Here’s how to do it:
sub-points: Ask your friend to open the Find My app on their phone.
Tap  in the lower right corner of the screen.
Scroll all the way down to the bottom and tap . This will open iCloud’s  page in Safari.

Tap  and log in with the Apple ID associated with your lost iPhone. From there, you can check if your phone’s location is displayed on the map, enable Notify When Found, or put your iPhone in Lost Mode.

steps.title: Turn off Lost Mode in the app or on the phone.
steps.subtitle: If you find your iPhone or you change your mind about marking it lost, you can easily deactivate Lost Mode in several ways.
sub-points: If you have the iPhone with you, simply turn it on and enter the passcode to unlock it. This will turn off Lost Mode.
In the Find My app on another device, go back to , tap your iPhone, and tap  or  under . Tap , then tap  to confirm.
In iCloud, click your iPhone in the  menu, click , then click . Click  again to confirm.

points.name: Enabling Find My on an iPhone

steps.title: Toggle on all the settings in the  screen.Find MyOn
steps.subtitle: To have the best chance of finding your iPhone if it’s lost and offline or dead, you’ll need to turn on all the  features. Tap the toggle switches next to each of the 3 options to set them to the   position if they aren’t on already.
sub-points: turns on all the basic features of the  app, including the ability to see your phone’s location and erase or lock it remotely in case it gets lost.
allows you to see the phone’s location for a short period of time even if it’s offline or powered off.
prompts your phone to send its location to Apple’s servers whenever the battery becomes critically low.
You can also turn on  in the main  menu to share your phone’s location with family and friends.
